ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Many laboratory and benchwork skills, along with data analysis tools.
Skills in biochem lab techniques including pipetting, plasmid mutation, protein expression and growth, assays, etc.
Its an easy wet lab course which is nice - very hands on and not stressful

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The pace is great to thoroughly understand the course material, and it is nice that the course is structured so that each week is one subsequent step of an experimental protocol. However, there is a lack of independence with the experiments, as we all are following one specific protocol at a specific pace.

It's a good introduction, although given students' various experience levels, it can start out feeling very ahead or behind of the course material. It's well organized, but more explanation of the structure of the course would be helpful

The course is not well organized at all. This is not at fault of the teaching team but of the program they used for teaching. I liked how most of the work was done in class but everything took way longer than it should have due to poor organization

I really enjoyed how the course was structured around the long-term completion of one biochemical objective--each week was a different step in the overall experimental protocol. The strength of the course is also its weakness, however. The protocol was developed by another school, so there were times where we had to make a lot of changes that meant we wasted time in lab and/or didn't achieve the end results we were looking for. Still a great learning experience, though.

One other weakness is that, apart from the quizzes, we didn't have anything graded throughout the semester (we had notebook checks, but weren't told what we received on those checks), so it was hard to know where you stood grade-wise.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is great to get a deep knowledge of the experimental method and the specific steps for protein mutation and expression analyses.
Yes if you want to gain experience in biochemistry labs
Its a little too slow if you already have wet lab experience but I liked having a bit of a break from extremely hard classes

I think this course was a great way to improve laboratory skills, especially those concerning a long-term experiment with one overarching objective. This models what research is like in an actual lab, so I think the experience of being in the class is very valuable for anyone interested in pursuing scientific work.
